question: where is south pole located on a map
vanilla_rag_result: The South Pole is located at the geographic South Pole, which is situated on the continent of Antarctica. It is the southernmost point on the surface of Earth and is found at an elevation of 2,835 meters (9,300 feet) above sea level. On a map, it is positioned at the center of the Southern Hemisphere, approximately 1,300 kilometers (800 miles) from the nearest open sea at the Bay of Whales.
